API¶

GP Regression¶

Gaussian Process Regression Module.

This module provides functionality for performing Gaussian Process (GP) regression to jointly estimate velocity and scalar fields. It includes the GPRegressionJoint class, which implements a GP model for predicting spatial and temporal derivatives of temperature fields based on observed data.

Key Features: - Joint estimation of velocity and scalar fields. - Support for polynomial basis functions for velocity and scalar fields. - Efficient computation using distance matrices and block diagonal structures.

Dependencies: - NumPy for numerical operations. - SciPy for linear algebra and optimization routines. - Utilities from the inversion_sst_gp package for data mapping.

Typical Use Case: This module is designed for applications in geophysical and environmental modeling, where Gaussian Process regression is used to infer velocity and scalar fields from observational data.

class inversion_sst_gp.gp_regression.GPRegressionJoint(dTds1o, dTds2o, dTdto, tstep, X, Y, maskp, degreeu=2, degreev=2, degreeS=2)¶

Bases: object

Gaussian Process Regression Model for joint estimation of velocity and scalar fields.

Attributes:
dTds1ondarray

Observed spatial derivative of temperature in the first direction.

dTds2ondarray

Observed spatial derivative of temperature in the second direction.

dTdtondarray

Observed temporal derivative of temperature.

Time step for the simulation.

Xndarray

Grid of x-coordinates.

Yndarray

Grid of y-coordinates.

maskpndarray

Mask for prediction locations.

degreeu, degreev, degreeSint, optional

Degrees for polynomial basis functions for velocity and scalar fields.

calculate negative restricted log marginal likelihood of z

Parameters:
params_vallist

Values of the parameters to optimize.

params_keylist

Keys corresponding to the parameters to optimize.

The Gaussian Process Regression Model instance.

Dictionary of constant parameters.

penalty_paramsdict

Dictionary of penalty parameters.

share_lenbool

Whether to share length scale parameters between velocity components.

share_sigmabool

Whether to share signal variance parameters between velocity components.

share_taubool

Whether to share noise variance parameters between velocity components.

solve_logbool

Whether to solve in the log space.

callbackstr

Callback option for printing progress.

Returns:
float

The negative restricted log marginal likelihood value.

construct_HA()¶

Constructs the HA matrix, which relates the observed derivatives to the prediction locations.

Returns:
ndarray

The constructed HA matrix.

Constructs the covariance matrix Kx for the velocity and scalar fields.

Parameters:
paramsdict

Dictionary of parameters for the covariance kernel.

Returns:
ndarray

The block diagonal covariance matrix Kx.

Dictionary of parameters for the covariance kernel.

The HA matrix.

The covariance matrix Kx.

The covariance matrix Kz.

estimate_params(initial_params, const_params, penalty_params={}, bounds_params={}, share_len=False, share_sigma=False, share_tau=False, solve_log=True, shgo_bool=False, callback='off')¶

Estimate the parameters of the Gaussian Process Regression Model.

Parameters:
initial_paramsdict

Initial guess for the parameters.

const_paramsdict

Dictionary of constant parameters.

penalty_paramsdict, optional

Dictionary of penalty parameters for regularization (default is empty).

bounds_paramsdict, optional

Dictionary of bounds for the parameters (default is empty).

share_lenbool, optional

Whether to share length scale parameters between velocity components (default is False).

share_sigmabool, optional

Whether to share signal variance parameters between velocity components (default is False).

share_taubool, optional

Whether to share noise variance parameters between velocity components (default is False).

solve_logbool, optional

Whether to solve in the log space (default is True).

shgo_boolbool, optional

Whether to use SHGO optimization (default is False).

callbackstr, optional

Callback option for printing progress (default is “off”).

Returns:
dict

The estimated parameters.

format_output(mux, Kx)¶

Format the output of the Gaussian Process regression.

Parameters:

mux (ndarray): Mean predictions for the velocity and scalar fields. Kx (ndarray): Covariance matrix for the velocity and scalar fields.

Returns:
tuple: Formatted outputs including mean predictions, standard deviations,

and velocity covariances mapped to the prediction grid.

predict(params, return_prior=False, return_Kxstar=False)¶

Perform predictions using the Gaussian Process Regression model.

Parameters:

params (dict): Parameters for the covariance kernel. return_prior (bool, optional): Whether to return prior predictions (default is False). return_Kxstar (bool, optional): Whether to return the posterior covariance matrix (default is False).

Returns:
tuple: Predicted mean and standard deviation for velocity and scalar fields,

and optionally the prior predictions and posterior covariance matrix.

class inversion_sst_gp.gp_regression.GPRegressionProcess(alpha, X, Y, degree=2)¶

Bases: object

Gaussian Process Regression for fitting covariance parameters of a process.

Attributes:

alpha (ndarray): Observed process values. s (ndarray): Spatial coordinates (X, Y). degree (int): Degree for polynomial basis functions. masko (ndarray): Mask for valid observation locations. alphao (ndarray): Observed process values at valid locations. d (ndarray): Distance matrix between observation locations. match_mask (ndarray): Mask for matching observation locations. phi (ndarray): Polynomial basis functions at observation locations.

Methods

calculate_negative_rlml_alpha(theta, alpha, ...)

Calculate the negative restricted log marginal likelihood (RLML) of the process.

calculate_rlml_alpha(theta, alpha, phi, d, ...)

Calculate the restricted log marginal likelihood (RLML) of the process.

estimate_beta(sigma, ls, tau)

Estimate the regression coefficients (beta) for the process.

estimate_theta(initial_sigma, initial_ls, ...)

Estimate the covariance parameters (sigma, length scale, and noise variance) for the process.
__init__(alpha, X, Y, degree=2)¶

Initialize the GPRegressionProcess instance.

Parameters:

alpha (ndarray): Observed process values. X (ndarray): Grid of x-coordinates. Y (ndarray): Grid of y-coordinates. degree (int, optional): Degree for polynomial basis functions (default is 2).

static calculate_negative_rlml_alpha(theta, alpha, phi, d, match_mask, solve_log)¶

Calculate the negative restricted log marginal likelihood (RLML) of the process.

Parameters:

theta (list): Parameters for the covariance kernel (sigma, ls, tau). alpha (ndarray): Observed process values. phi (ndarray): Polynomial basis functions. d (ndarray): Distance matrix between observation locations. match_mask (ndarray): Mask for matching observation locations. solve_log (bool): Whether to solve in the log space.

Returns:

float: Negative restricted log marginal likelihood value.

static calculate_rlml_alpha(theta, alpha, phi, d, match_mask, solve_log)¶

Calculate the restricted log marginal likelihood (RLML) of the process.

Parameters:

theta (list): Parameters for the covariance kernel (sigma, ls, tau). alpha (ndarray): Observed process values. phi (ndarray): Polynomial basis functions. d (ndarray): Distance matrix between observation locations. match_mask (ndarray): Mask for matching observation locations. solve_log (bool): Whether to solve in the log space.

Returns:

float: Restricted log marginal likelihood value.

estimate_beta(sigma, ls, tau)¶

Estimate the regression coefficients (beta) for the process.

Parameters:

sigma (float): Signal variance parameter. ls (float): Length scale parameter. tau (float): Noise variance parameter.

Returns:

ndarray: Estimated regression coefficients.

estimate_theta(initial_sigma, initial_ls, initial_tau, solve_log=False)¶

Estimate the covariance parameters (sigma, length scale, and noise variance) for the process.

Parameters:

initial_sigma (float): Initial guess for the signal variance parameter. initial_ls (float): Initial guess for the length scale parameter. initial_tau (float): Initial guess for the noise variance parameter. solve_log (bool, optional): Whether to optimize in the log space (default is False).

Returns:

tuple: Estimated values for sigma, length scale, and noise variance.

inversion_sst_gp.gp_regression.calculate_prediction_gpregression(dTds1, dTds2, dTdt, params, X, Y, tstep, maskp=None, degreeu=2, degreev=2, degreeS=2, return_Kxstar=False)¶

Calculate predictions using Gaussian Process regression.

Parameters:

dTds1 (ndarray): Observed spatial derivative of temperature in the first direction. dTds2 (ndarray): Observed spatial derivative of temperature in the second direction. dTdt (ndarray): Observed temporal derivative of temperature. params (dict): Parameters for the covariance kernel. X (ndarray): Grid of x-coordinates. Y (ndarray): Grid of y-coordinates. tstep (float): Time step for the simulation. maskp (ndarray, optional): Mask for prediction locations (default is None). degreeu (int, optional): Degree for polynomial basis functions for the u-component (default is 2). degreev (int, optional): Degree for polynomial basis functions for the v-component (default is 2). degreeS (int, optional): Degree for polynomial basis functions for the scalar field (default is 2). return_Kxstar (bool, optional): Whether to return the posterior covariance matrix (default is False).

Returns:
tuple: Predicted mean and standard deviation for velocity and scalar fields,

and optionally the posterior covariance matrix.

inversion_sst_gp.gp_regression.chol(M)¶

Perform Cholesky decomposition of a matrix.

Parameters:
Mndarray

Symmetric positive-definite matrix to decompose.

Returns:
ndarray

Lower triangular matrix resulting from the decomposition.

inversion_sst_gp.gp_regression.chol2inv(L)¶

Compute the inverse of a matrix using its Cholesky decomposition.

Parameters:
Lndarray

Lower triangular matrix from Cholesky decomposition.

Returns:
ndarray

Inverse of the original matrix.

inversion_sst_gp.gp_regression.cholinv(M)¶

Compute the inverse of a matrix directly through Cholesky decomposition.

Parameters:
Mndarray

Symmetric positive-definite matrix to invert.

Returns:
ndarray

Inverse of the matrix.

inversion_sst_gp.gp_regression.estimate_params_process(process, X, Y, initial_sigma, initial_ls, initial_tau, degree=2, solve_log=True)¶

Estimate the parameters for a Gaussian Process regression process.

Parameters:

process (ndarray): Observed process values. X (ndarray): Grid of x-coordinates. Y (ndarray): Grid of y-coordinates. initial_sigma (float): Initial guess for the signal variance parameter. initial_ls (float): Initial guess for the length scale parameter. initial_tau (float): Initial guess for the noise variance parameter. degree (int, optional): Degree for polynomial basis functions (default is 2). solve_log (bool, optional): Whether to optimize in the log space (default is True).

Returns:

tuple: Estimated values for sigma, length scale, and noise variance.

inversion_sst_gp.gp_regression.kernel_matern_3_2_var(d, match_mask, sigma, ls, tau)¶

Compute the Matern covariance function (nu=3/2) with additional variance.

Parameters:
dndarray

Distance matrix between points.

match_maskndarray

Mask for matching observation locations.

sigmafloat

Signal variance parameter.

lsfloat

Length scale parameter.

taufloat

Noise variance parameter.

Returns:
ndarray

Covariance matrix with Matern kernel and additional variance.

Intercept term.

Coefficient for the first spatial dimension.

Coefficient for the second spatial dimension.

s1ndarray

First spatial coordinate.

s2ndarray

Second spatial coordinate.

degreeint

Degree of the polynomial basis functions.

Returns:
ndarray

Polynomial basis functions evaluated at the given coordinates.

Metrics¶

Metrics module for model evaluation.

This module provides functions to compute various scoring metrics for evaluating model performance, including RMSE, correlation coefficients, and probabilistic metrics.

inversion_sst_gp.metrics.RMSE(u0, v0, up, vp)¶

Computes the Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) for velocity vectors.

Parameters:
u0ndarray

True values of the u-component of velocity.

v0ndarray

True values of the v-component of velocity.

upndarray

Predicted values of the u-component of velocity.

vpndarray

Predicted values of the v-component of velocity.

Returns:
float

The computed RMSE value.

inversion_sst_gp.metrics.coverage90(x, mu, sigma)¶

Computes the coverage probability of a 90% confidence interval.

Parameters:
xndarray

Observed values.

mundarray

Predicted mean values.

sigmandarray

Predicted standard deviations.

Returns:
float

The proportion of observed values within the 90% confidence interval.

inversion_sst_gp.metrics.crps_norm(x, mu, sigma)¶

Computes the Continuous Ranked Probability Score (CRPS) for normally distributed forecasts.

Parameters:
xndarray

Observed values.

mundarray

Predicted mean values.

sigmandarray

Predicted standard deviations.

Returns:
float

The computed CRPS value.

inversion_sst_gp.metrics.overview(u0, v0, muu, muv, stdu=None, stdv=None, print_bool=False)¶

Computes an overview of various metrics for model evaluation.

Parameters:
u0ndarray

True values of the u-component of velocity.

v0ndarray

True values of the v-component of velocity.

muundarray

Predicted mean values of the u-component of velocity.

muvndarray

Predicted mean values of the v-component of velocity.

stdundarray, optional

Standard deviation of the predicted u-component (if probabilistic).

stdvndarray, optional

Standard deviation of the predicted v-component (if probabilistic).

print_boolbool, optional

Whether to print the computed metrics.

Returns:
dict

Dictionary containing computed metrics such as RMSE, rho_mag, phi, crps_norm, and coverage90.

inversion_sst_gp.metrics.phi(u0, v0, up, vp)¶

Computes the angle (in degrees) of the complex correlation coefficient between true and predicted velocity vectors.

Parameters:
u0ndarray

True values of the u-component of velocity.

v0ndarray

True values of the v-component of velocity.

upndarray

Predicted values of the u-component of velocity.

vpndarray

Predicted values of the v-component of velocity.

Returns:
float

The angle (in degrees) of the complex correlation coefficient.

inversion_sst_gp.metrics.rho_mag(u0, v0, up, vp)¶

Computes the magnitude of the complex correlation coefficient between true and predicted velocity vectors.

Parameters:
u0ndarray

True values of the u-component of velocity.

v0ndarray

True values of the v-component of velocity.

upndarray

Predicted values of the u-component of velocity.

vpndarray

Predicted values of the v-component of velocity.

Returns:
float

The magnitude of the complex correlation coefficient.

inversion_sst_gp.metrics.rho_vec(u0, v0, up, vp)¶

Computes the complex correlation coefficient between true and predicted velocity vectors.

Parameters:
u0ndarray

True values of the u-component of velocity.

v0ndarray

True values of the v-component of velocity.

upndarray

Predicted values of the u-component of velocity.

vpndarray

Predicted values of the v-component of velocity.

Returns:
complex

The complex correlation coefficient.

Plots a quiver plot with optional annotation.

Parameters:
axmatplotlib.axes.Axes

The axes to plot on.

xndarray

Grid of x-coordinates.

yndarray

Grid of y-coordinates.

undarray

Velocity field in the x-direction.

vndarray

Velocity field in the y-direction.

scalefloat, optional

Scale factor for the quiver plot. Default is 1.

unitfloat, optional

Unit vector length for annotation. Default is 1.

labelstr, optional

Label for the annotation. Default is an empty string.

xlimstuple, optional

x-axis limits. Default is None.

ylimstuple, optional

y-axis limits. Default is None.

nxint, optional

Number of vectors in the x-direction. Default is None.

nyint, optional

Number of vectors in the y-direction. Default is None.

anbool, optional

Whether to add annotation. Default is True.

**kwargsdict

Additional keyword arguments for quiver.

Returns:
matplotlib.quiver.Quiver

The quiver plot object.

inversion_sst_gp.plot_helper.visualize_data(LON, LAT, T, dTdt, dTds1, dTds2, u=None, v=None, lonlims=None, latlims=None, plimT=None, plimTgrad=None, plimdTdt=None, plimspeed=None, pscale=4, nx=17, ny=17, plt_show=False, return_fig=False, label_obs=True)¶

Utilities¶

Utility functions for geographic and numerical computations.

This module provides a collection of utility functions for tasks such as coordinate transformations, finite difference calculations, vorticity calculations, and JSON file handling.

class inversion_sst_gp.utils.NumpyEncoder(*, skipkeys=False, ensure_ascii=True, check_circular=True, allow_nan=True, sort_keys=False, indent=None, separators=None, default=None)¶

Bases: JSONEncoder

Custom JSON encoder for handling NumPy data types.

Methods

default(obj)

Implement this method in a subclass such that it returns a serializable object for o, or calls the base implementation (to raise a TypeError).

encode(o)

Return a JSON string representation of a Python data structure.

iterencode(o[, _one_shot])

Encode the given object and yield each string representation as available.
default(obj)¶

Implement this method in a subclass such that it returns a serializable object for o, or calls the base implementation (to raise a TypeError).

For example, to support arbitrary iterators, you could implement default like this:

def default(self, o):
    try:
        iterable = iter(o)
    except TypeError:
        pass
    else:
        return list(iterable)
    # Let the base class default method raise the TypeError
    return super().default(o)

GOS¶

GOS module.

This module implements the Global Optimal Solution (GOS) method for computing ocean surface currents from SST.

class inversion_sst_gp.gos.GlobalOptimalSolution(dTds1, dTds2, dTdt)¶

Bases: object

Implements the Global Optimal Solution (GOS) method for solving the heat equation in 2D.

Attributes:
dTds1ndarray

Spatial derivative of temperature in the first direction.

dTds2ndarray

Spatial derivative of temperature in the second direction.

dTdtndarray

Temporal derivative of temperature.

N2int

Number of rows in the temperature grid.

N1int

Number of columns in the temperature grid.

Nint

Total number of grid points.

Methods

compute(n[, corner])

Computes the Global Optimal Solution (GOS) for the heat equation.

interpolate(field[, method])

Interpolates a given field using the specified method.

optimize_n(u0, v0[, nmin, nmax])

Optimizes the subsampling factor n to minimize RMSE with respect to a reference velocity field.

solve_at_knots(n[, corner])

Solves the heat equation at knot points using the Chen et al. (2008) method.

subgrid(n[, corner])

Creates a subgrid and masks for cropping and knot placement.
__init__(dTds1, dTds2, dTdt)¶

Initializes the GlobalOptimalSolution class with the given temperature derivatives.

Parameters:
dTds1ndarray

Spatial derivative of temperature in the first direction.

dTds2ndarray

Spatial derivative of temperature in the second direction.

dTdtndarray

Temporal derivative of temperature.

compute(n, corner='all')¶

Computes the Global Optimal Solution (GOS) for the heat equation.

Parameters:
nint

Subsampling factor for the grid.

cornerstr or int, optional

Corner index for cropping (‘all’ or 0 to 3).

Returns:
tuple

Contains the computed GOS values for u, v, and S.

interpolate(field, method='linear')¶

Interpolates a given field using the specified method.

Parameters:
fieldndarray

The field to interpolate.

methodstr, optional

Interpolation method (‘linear’, ‘nearest’, etc.). Default is ‘linear’.

Returns:
ndarray

Interpolated field.

optimize_n(u0, v0, nmin=None, nmax=None)¶

Optimizes the subsampling factor n to minimize RMSE with respect to a reference velocity field.

Parameters:
u0ndarray

Reference u-component of velocity.

v0ndarray

Reference v-component of velocity.

nminint, optional

Minimum value of n to consider. Default is 3.

nmaxint, optional

Maximum value of n to consider. Default is half the grid dimensions.

Returns:
int

Optimal value of n.

solve_at_knots(n, corner=0)¶

Solves the heat equation at knot points using the Chen et al. (2008) method.

Parameters:
nint

Subsampling factor for the grid.

cornerint, optional

Corner index for cropping (0 to 3).

Returns:
tuple

Contains the solved values for u, v, and S at knot points, and the knot mask.

subgrid(n, corner=0)¶

Creates a subgrid and masks for cropping and knot placement.

Parameters:
nint

Subsampling factor for the grid.

cornerint, optional

Corner index for cropping (0 to 3).

Returns:
tuple

Contains subgrid dimensions, crop mask, and knot mask.

inversion_sst_gp.gos.calculate_prediction_gos(dTds1, dTds2, dTdt, n)¶

Calculates the Global Optimal Solution (GOS) prediction for the given temperature derivatives.

Parameters:
dTds1ndarray

Spatial derivative of temperature in the first direction.

dTds2ndarray

Spatial derivative of temperature in the second direction.

dTdtndarray

Temporal derivative of temperature.

nint

Subsampling factor for the grid.

Returns:
tuple

Contains the predicted GOS values for u, v, and S.

Simulation¶

Particle tracking module.

This module provides functionality to simulate particle trajectories in a flow field using geographic and velocity data.

inversion_sst_gp.simulation.particle_tracking.simulate_flow_fields(Kxstar, muustar, muvstar, Ny, Nx, n_sample)¶

Simulates flow fields from a Gaussian process posterior.

Parameters:
Kxstarndarray

Covariance matrix for the posterior.

muustarndarray

Mean of the u-component of the velocity field.

muvstarndarray

Mean of the v-component of the velocity field.

Nyint

Number of grid points in the y-direction.

Nxint

Number of grid points in the x-direction.

n_sampleint

Number of samples to generate.

Returns:
tuple

Arrays of sampled u and v velocity fields.

inversion_sst_gp.simulation.particle_tracking.simulate_from_kernel(K, n_samples=1, mu=None)¶

Simulates samples from a Gaussian process kernel.

Parameters:
Kndarray

Covariance matrix (kernel).

n_samplesint, optional

Number of samples to generate. Default is 1.

mundarray or float, optional

Mean vector. Default is 0.

Returns:
ndarray

Simulated samples.

inversion_sst_gp.simulation.particle_tracking.simulate_particle_flow_field(X, Y, u, v, lon0, lat0, lonc, latc, tstep, N)¶

Simulates the trajectory of a particle in a flow field.

Parameters:
Xndarray

Grid of x-coordinates.

Yndarray

Grid of y-coordinates.

undarray

Velocity field in the x-direction.

vndarray

Velocity field in the y-direction.

Initial longitude of the particle.

lat0float

Initial latitude of the particle.

Reference longitude for the coordinate system.

latcfloat

Reference latitude for the coordinate system.

tstepfloat

Time step for the simulation.

Nint

Number of time steps to simulate.

Returns:
tuple

Simulates particle trajectories for multiple flow fields.

Grid of y-coordinates.

Simulation and modification of observational data.

This module provides functionality to simulate tracer observations from model data and modify the data with various noise and coverage patterns.

class inversion_sst_gp.simulation.simulate_obs.ModifyData(T, dTdt, tstep, X, Y)¶

Bases: object

A class to modify tracer data (T and dTdt) with noise and coverage patterns.

Attributes:

T (ndarray): Tracer data. dTdt (ndarray): Time derivative of tracer data. tstep (float): Time step size. s (ndarray): Spatial coordinates (X, Y). N2 (int): Number of rows in the data. N1 (int): Number of columns in the data. masko (ndarray): Mask indicating valid data points.

Methods

circ_cloud(coverage)

Generate a circular cloud coverage pattern at the center.

convert_to_input()

Convert the modified data to input format for further processing.

noise(sigma_tau)

Add Gaussian noise to the tracer data.

sparse_cloud(coverage)

Generate a sparse cloud coverage pattern.
__init__(T, dTdt, tstep, X, Y)¶

Initialize the ModifyData object.

Parameters:

T (ndarray): Tracer data. dTdt (ndarray): Time derivative of tracer data. tstep (float): Time step size. X (ndarray): X-coordinates of the grid. Y (ndarray): Y-coordinates of the grid.

circ_cloud(coverage)¶

Generate a circular cloud coverage pattern at the center.

Parameters:

coverage (float): Fraction of points to be covered.

Returns:

ModifyData: The modified data object.

convert_to_input()¶

Convert the modified data to input format for further processing.

Returns:

tuple: Modified tracer data, spatial gradients, and mask.

noise(sigma_tau)¶

Add Gaussian noise to the tracer data.

Parameters:

sigma_tau (float): Standard deviation of the noise.

Returns:

ModifyData: The modified data object.

sparse_cloud(coverage)¶

Generate a sparse cloud coverage pattern.

Parameters:

coverage (float): Fraction of points to be covered.

Returns:

ModifyData: The modified data object.
